publication.abstract: The Chemistry Development Kit (CDK) is a freely available open-source Java library for Structural Chemo- and Bioinformatics. Its architecture and capabilities as well as the development as an open-source project by a team of international collaborators from academic and industrial institutions is described. The CDK provides methods for many common tasks in molecular informatics, including 2D and 3D rendering of chemical structures, I/O routines, SMILES parsing and generation, ring searches, isomorphism checking, structure diagram generation, etc. Application scenarios as well as access information for interested users and potential contributors are given.
publication.journal: Journal of Chemical Information and Computer Sciences
publication.title: The Chemistry Development Kit (CDK): An open-source Java library for chemo- and bioinformatics

publication.abstract: The Chemistry Development Kit (CDK) provides methods for common tasks in molecular informatics, including 2D and 3D rendering of chemical structures, I/O routines, SMILES parsing and generation, ring searches, isomorphism checking, structure diagram generation, etc. Implemented in Java, it is used both for server-side computational services, possibly equipped with a web interface, as well as for applications and client-side applets. This article introduces the CDK's new QSAR capabilities and the recently introduced interface to statistical software. Â© 2006 Bentham Science Publishers Ltd.
publication.title: Recent developments of the Chemistry Development Kit (CDK) - An open-source Java library for chemo- and bioinformatics

summary.description: Open source Java library for bio- and cheminformatics.
summary.name: The Chemistry Development Kit
